p: The effects of MLVA on neuro-inflammation in mid brain, cerebrum and cerebellum of the experimental rats was evaluated by measuring MPO activities and NO concentration level. Rats administered nitrobenzene alone demonstrated a marked increase in NO level and MPO activities in all the brain sections when compared with the control ( Fig. 2, Fig. 3). However, treatment with of 200 and 400 mg/kg of MLVA or Vitamin E significantly attenuated both NO and MPO levels in the midbrain, cerebrum and cerebellum when compared with control.
